doc.after: Ensuring national security increasing influence among its Arab neighbors and securing the return of the Golan Heights are the primary goals of President Bashar al Assad s foreign policy At many points in its history Syria has seen virulent tension with its geographically cultural neighbors such as Turkey Israel Iraq and Lebanon Syria enjoyed an improvement in relations with several of the states in its region in the 21st century prior to the Arab Spring and the Syrian civil war
